page.title: 01THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is an area of flat open fields interspersed with thick hedges and small coppices. The land is mostly under 100 m above sea level and laid mainly to crops. The farms are large and scattered. The highest point is the village of Takeley at 100 m. Water supply is a problem and pressure has to be aided by water towers. Most of the residential development has taken place along the A120, a very busy major road joining the A1 to the A12.The area is well drained by small streams which drain eastwards into the River Roding or westwards into Pincey Brook. At present this is a quiet rural area designated as green belt. Recently however, the government has given nearby Stansted Airport the go-ahead for expansion. We are all unsure of what the future now holds for the village of Takeley.
